question.title: Java Azure function fails to start with error "Azure.RequestFailedException : This request is not authorized.."
question.body:
I have a java azure function with blob triggers. We are moving from connection string based authentication to managed identity based authentication. Please find the azure function configs we have below:

1.Java 17 runtime

2.Bundles in host.json

"version": "2.0",
"extensionBundle": {
    "id": "Microsoft.Azure.Functions.ExtensionBundle",
    "version": "[4.*, 5.0.0)"
}

  1. Using App service plan "Premium v2 P3V2".

  2. Azure function app's VNET subnet is listed under Storage account's allowed VNET accesses.

  3. Disabled System-assigned identity and added required roles in user managed identity as per documentation as shown below:

  1. Added required environment variables in app settings:

  1. removed connection string setting "AzureWebJobsStorage=connection-string"

  2. Added app setting "keyVaultReferenceIdentity=identity-resource-id"

Error snapshot:

Please help me. Thanks in advance.

answers.body:
Follow below steps to connect function app with storage account using managed identity.

  1. I have created Java Blob triggered Azure function.
public class BlobTriggerJava1 {

    @FunctionName("BlobTriggerJava1")
    @StorageAccount("AzureWebJobsStorage")
    public void run(
        @BlobTrigger(name = "content", path = "samples-workitems/{name}", dataType = "binary") byte[] content,
        @BindingName("name") String name,
        final ExecutionContext context
    ) {
        context.getLogger().info("Java Blob trigger function processed a blob. Name: " + name + "\n  Size: " + content.length + " Bytes");
    }
}

host.json:

{
  "version": "2.0",
  "extensionBundle": {
    "id": "Microsoft.Azure.Functions.ExtensionBundle",
    "version": "[3.*, 4.0.0)"
  },
  "concurrency": {
    "dynamicConcurrencyEnabled": true,
    "snapshotPersistenceEnabled": true
  }
}
  1. Created Function App with App Service Plan Premium v2 P3V2.
  2. Enable User Assigned Managed Identity in function app.
  3. Add below App settings in function app under Environment Variables=>App Settiings:
AzureWebJobsStorage__accountName = <Storage_Account_Name>
AzureWebJobsStorage__blobServiceUri= https://StorageAccountName.blob.core.windows.net/
AzureWebJobsStorage__clientId= ClientID of User Assigned Managed Identity
AzureWebJobsStorage__credential = managedidentity
AzureWebJobsStorage__queueServiceUri = https://StorageAccountName.queue.core.windows.net/

Assign below roles to function App's managed identity.

Storage Account Contributor
Storage Blob Data Contributor
Storage Queue Data Contributor

Upload the file to storage Container.

Able to trigger the Blob Trigger Azure function.

Added "Reader" role for the blob storage in the user managed identity, restarted the app which fixed the issue.

Error from the notifications tab is vanished. Functions are healthy and processes blobs successfully.
